intro: Oenothera angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oily seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Oenothera angustifolia is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
